result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham Mc Cormick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of extended supervision.  Attorney Fees to be collected by the Department and reimbursed to Ozaukee County Clerk of Courts office. Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes: to be paid during extended supervision on counts 4 and 5

from Defendant re: Petition.

Petition denied under Escalona Naranjo, 185 Wis. 2d 168. Further, court notes that stand-by counsel was appointed and was proficient. Though in place for the court rather than the defendant, stand-by counsel, with defendant's consent, conducted cross examination and closing argument. The jury for a time reported it was deadlocked. The court further notes that stand-by counsel is one of the top defense attorney's in this area. Any error was harmless. Petition denied.

Defendant Abraham  Mc Cormick in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Stipulations placed on record. 9:37am Jurors brought into courtroom. Jurors sworn. Voir dire by Court. Voir dire by State. No Voir dire by Defendant. Striking of panel. 12 jurors sworn. Remaining jurors thanked & excused. Recess. 10:35am Recalled, appearances same. Jury returns to courtroom. Preliminary instructions to jurors. 10:45am Opening statement by DA Gerol. No opening statement from Defendant. State calls Deputy J Byrnes sworn & testified. 11:28am Cross exam. Redirect. 11:40am State calls Sgt. M Riley sworn & testified. Cross exam. 11:53am Jury excused from courtroom. 12:04pm Recess for lunch. 1:20pm In session, appearances same Jury returns to courtroom. State calls JM of the WI state crime lab. No cross exam. Video shown by state. State rests. 2:06pm Jury excused from courtroom. Defendant moves for dismissal. Court denies motion. Jury instruction conference. 2:35pm Jury returns to courtroom. Defense rests without testimony. Court instructs jurors. 2:50pm Closing argument by State. 3:08pm Closing argument by Defendant. 3:15pm Rebuttal by State. 3:24pm Oath to bailiff. Jury panel excused to deliberate. 4:45pm In session, appearances same, jury not present. Question from jury panel. Response to jurors question given to panel in jury room. 5:25pm In session, appearances same, Jury not present. Question read from jury. 5:30pm Jury panel brought into courtroom. Court instructs jurors as to answer to question. 5:32pm Jury excused to continue deliberation. 5:47pm In session, appearances same. Jury called to courtroom.Jury foreperson identified (RB). Jury finds count 4:  guilty         Jury finds count 6:  guilty    Jury polled.  5:53pm Jury thanked & excused. State moves for judgment on the verdicts for counts 4,5,6. Court directs judgment.  Bail revoked, remanded. Statements by Defendant. State requests presentence investigation.

Defendant Abraham  Mc Cormick in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State prepared for trial. Additional motions by defendant have been filed and would like to be heard. Court address' each of defendant's motions. Motion as to jurisdiction, denied. Motion as to challenge of stop, denied. Motion as to illegal search seizure, denied. Defendant states his objections on the record. Jury trial will proceed.
Writ of Error Coram Vobis

Defendant Abraham Mc Cormick in court, in custody.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Mr McCormick. State is ready to proceed with prelim. State calls Deputy Jamie Burns sworn & testified. Defendant objects to the witness' testimony. State requests court take judicial notice of felony cases in Milw, Waukesha and Wash Co. Statement by Mr Mccormick. Defendant sworn. Documents filed to the Court and DA by defendant. (Affidavit of Facts, Notice of Acceptance, Notice of Dismissal Show Cause, Notice and Demand) Affidavit and filings read onto the record by Defendant. Evidence closed.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed. Information read to defendant by Court. Court will set for trial within 90 days of arraignment date (8/20/14) due to belief that defendant is unrepresented and speedy trial demand is being requested. Defendant admonished with possible contempt of court. Hearing adjourned.
Preliminary hearing on July 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Conditions set by court: no possession of weapons, cooperate with booking procedures of the Oz. Sheriff Dept and its officers

Defendant Abraham Mc Cormick in court, in custody.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Defendant refuses assistance of public defender. Court finds probable cause. Copy of complaint provided to defendant. State requests $50,000 cash bail, def fails to identify self and cooperate with booking and other conditions.  Court sets matter be scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
